Package camzup.pfriendly

Interface IUp

All Known Subinterfaces:
IUp3, IUpOgl, IYup2
All Known Implementing Classes:
Up3, UpOgl, Yup2, Yup3, YupJ2, Zup3
public interface IUp
Maintains consistent behavior across renderers in the CamZup library. Secondarily, supports core to Processing conversions (e.g., PVector to Vec3) and altered PMatrix3D functions. (PMatrix3D is marked final and thus cannot be extended.)

    • DEFAULT_ASPECT

      static final float DEFAULT_ASPECT
      Assumes 1920 / 1080, 1.7778 .

      Constant Field Values

    • DEFAULT_CAM_DIST_FAC

      static final float DEFAULT_CAM_DIST_FAC
      Default scalar by which the height of the sketch is multiplied when the default camera function is called. sqrt ( 3.0 ) / 2.0 .
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • DEFAULT_COLOR_MAX

      static final float DEFAULT_COLOR_MAX
      The Processing default color max.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • DEFAULT_FAR_CLIP

      static final float DEFAULT_FAR_CLIP
      Default far-clip when orthographic or perspective functions are called without the near and far arguments. 1000.0 .
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • DEFAULT_FILL_COLOR

      static final int DEFAULT_FILL_COLOR
      Default fill color, a light blue.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • DEFAULT_FOV

      static final float DEFAULT_FOV
      Default field of view for a perspective camera projection. PI / 3.0 .
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • DEFAULT_GLYPH_DETAIL

      static final float DEFAULT_GLYPH_DETAIL
      When a non-zero value is supplied, a font glyph is flattened to line segments.
      See Also:

      static final float DEFAULT_HALF_HEIGHT
      Assumes height of 1080 . 1080 / 2 = 540 .

      static final float DEFAULT_HALF_WIDTH
      Assumes width of 1920 . 1920 / 2 = 960 .
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

      static final int DEFAULT_HANDLE_COLOR
      Color for the lines connected the forehandle, coord and rearhandle of a curve knot. Currently diagnostic only, and so not adjustable.

  • Method Details

    • det3x3

      static float det3x3​(float t00, float t01, float t02, float t10, float t11, float t12, float t20, float t21, float t22)
      Helper function for inverting a PMatrix3D. Finds the determinant for a 3x3 section of a 4x4 matrix.
      Parameters:
      t00 - row 0, column 0
      t01 - row 0, column 1
      t02 - row 0, column 2
      t10 - row 1, column 0
      t11 - row 1, column 1
      t12 - row 1, column 2
      t20 - row 2, column 0
      t21 - row 2, column 1
      t22 - row 2, column 2
      Returns:
      the determinant

    • frustum

      static PMatrix3D frustum​(float left, float right, float bottom, float top, float near, float far)
      Creates a view frustum given the edges of the view port.
      Parameters:
      left - the left edge of the window
      right - the right edge of the window
      bottom - the bottom edge of the window
      top - the top edge of the window
      near - the near clip plane
      far - the far clip plane
      Returns:
      the view frustum

    • frustum

      static PMatrix3D frustum​(float left, float right, float bottom, float top, float near, float far, PMatrix3D target)
      Creates a view frustum given the edges of the view port.
      Parameters:
      left - the left edge of the window
      right - the right edge of the window
      bottom - the bottom edge of the window
      top - the top edge of the window
      near - the near clip plane
      far - the far clip plane
      target - the output matrix
      Returns:
      the view frustum

    • getGlyph

      static java.util.List<Curve2> getGlyph​(java.awt.Font font, java.awt.font.FontRenderContext frc, java.awt.geom.AffineTransform transform, float detail, char character, java.util.List<Curve2> curves)
      A function to convert a character to an list of curve entities. A helper function for other variants of getGlyph.
      Parameters:
      font - the awt font
      frc - the font render context
      transform - the AWT affine transform
      detail - the detail
      character - the character
      curves - the list of curves
      Returns:
      the list of curves
      See Also:
      Font.createGlyphVector(FontRenderContext, char[]), GlyphVector.getOutline(), Shape.getPathIterator(java.awt.geom.AffineTransform), Shape.getPathIterator(java.awt.geom.AffineTransform, double), Font.getSize(), PathIterator.currentSegment(float[]), Vec2.mix(Vec2, Vec2, float, Vec2)

    • getGlyph

      static CurveEntity2[] getGlyph​(java.awt.Graphics2D graphics, java.awt.geom.AffineTransform transform, PFont pfont, float detail, char... characters)
      Gets an array of curves from a PFont. The Graphics2D input can be retrieved from a PGraphicsJava2D renderer. The AffineTransform can be null.
      Parameters:
      graphics - the AWT Graphics2D
      transform - the AWT affine transform
      pfont - the PFont
      detail - the glyph detail
      characters - the characteres
      Returns:
      the array of Curve2s

    • getGlyph

      static CurveEntity2[] getGlyph​(PFont pfont, float detail, char... characters)
      To convert a character to a glyph with OpenGL- based renderers, Processing uses a deprecated method from an AWT function. That method call has been isolated to this function.
      Parameters:
      pfont - the Processing font
      detail - the curve detail
      characters - the characters
      Returns:
      the array of glyphs
      See Also:
      Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit()

    • invert

      static PMatrix3D invert​(PMatrix3D m, PMatrix3D target)
      Inverts the input matrix. This is an expensive operation, and so matrix inverses should be cached when needed.
      Parameters:
      m - the matrix
      target - the output matrix
      Returns:
      the inverted matrix
      See Also:
      det3x3(float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float), PMatrix3D.determinant()

    • mult

      static PMatrix3D mult​(PMatrix3D a, PMatrix3D b)
      Multiplies two matrices together. Matrix multiplication is not commutative, so the PMatrix3D class calls in-place multiplication "apply" and "preApply."
      Parameters:
      a - the left operand
      b - the right operand
      Returns:
      the product
      See Also:
      PMatrix3D.apply(PMatrix3D), PMatrix3D.preApply(PMatrix3D)

    • mult

      static PMatrix3D mult​(PMatrix3D a, PMatrix3D b, PMatrix3D target)
      Multiplies two matrices together. Matrix multiplication is not commutative, so the PMatrix3D class calls in-place multiplication "apply" and "preApply."
      Parameters:
      a - the left operand
      b - the right operand
      target - the output matrix
      Returns:
      the product
      See Also:
      PMatrix3D.apply(PMatrix3D), PMatrix3D.preApply(PMatrix3D)

    • orthographic

      static PMatrix3D orthographic​(float left, float right, float bottom, float top, float near, float far)
      Creates an orthographic projection matrix, where objects maintain their size regardless of distance from the camera.
      Parameters:
      left - the left edge of the window
      right - the right edge of the window
      bottom - the bottom edge of the window
      top - the top edge of the window
      near - the near clip plane
      far - the far clip plane
      Returns:
      the orthographic projection

    • perspective

      static PMatrix3D perspective​(float fov, float aspect, float near, float far)
      Creates a perspective projection matrix, where objects nearer to the camera appear larger than objects distant from the camera.
      Parameters:
      fov - the field of view
      aspect - the aspect ratio, width over height
      near - the near clip plane
      far - the far clip plane
      Returns:
      the perspective projection

    • rotateX

      static PMatrix3D rotateX​(float radians)
      PMatrix3D's instance methods for rotating around orthonormal axes defer to rotation about an arbitrary axis. This is not necessary for rotate X.
      Parameters:
      radians - the angle in radians
      Returns:
      the rotation matrix

    • rotateX

      Parameters:
      radians - the angle in radians
      target - the matrix
      Returns:
      the mutated matrix

    • glyph

      default CurveEntity2[] glyph​(PFont pfont, float detail, char... characters)
      Converts a an array of characters to a an array of curve entities. When the level of detail is 0, uses Bezier curves; when the detailis non-zero, approximates the glyph with a series of straight line segments. The PFont should have been created with createFont, not loadFont.
      Parameters:
      pfont - the PFont
      detail - the level of detail
      characters - the characters
      Returns:
      the array

    • glyph

      default CurveEntity2[] glyph​(PFont pfont, float detail, java.lang.String str)
      Converts a string to a an array of curve entities. When the level of detail is 0, uses Bezier curves; when the detailis non-zero, approximates the glyph with a series of straight line segments. The PFont should have been created with createFont, not loadFont.
      Parameters:
      pfont - the PFont
      detail - the level of detail
      str - the string
      Returns:
      the array

    • lerpColor

      Color lerpColor​(Color origin, Color dest, float step, Color target)
      Eases from an origin color to a destination by a step.
      Parameters:
      origin - the origin color
      dest - the destination color
      step - the factor in [0, 1]
      target - the output color
      Returns:
      the color

    • lerpColor

      int lerpColor​(int origin, int dest, float step)
      Eases from an origin color to a destination by a step, where colors are stored in integers.
      Parameters:
      origin - the origin color
      dest - the destination color
      step - the factor in [0, 1]
      Returns:
      the color

    • origin

      void origin()
      Draws the world origin.

    • stroke

      default void stroke()
      Uses the renderer's default stroke color.

    • stroke

      default void stroke​(Color c)
      Sets the renderer's current stroke to the color.
      Parameters:
      c - the color

    • stroke

      void stroke​(int c)
      Sets the renderer's current stroke to the hexadecimal value.
      Parameters:
      c - the color in hexadecimal

    • strokeWeight

      default void strokeWeight()
      Uses the renderer's default stroke weight.

    • strokeWeight

      void strokeWeight​(float sw)
      Sets the renderer's stroke weight.
      Parameters:
      sw - the weight
